alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 5:07AM EST until December 20 at 9:34PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maine... Sandy River At Mercer affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandy River at Mercer. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, extensive flooding in Farmington, particularly along Main Street south of the University. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Tuesday was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 03/15/1977. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
